thread.title: Hong Kong Airlines HX693 IncidentTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Hong Kong Airlines HX693 IncidentTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Hong Kong Airlines HX693 Incident Published on : Monday, October 5, 2015
Hong Kong Airlines flight HX693 scheduled to fly from Sapporo to Hong Kong on 3 October at 4:50 p.m. local time has encountered hydraulic system problems before take-off. Based on safety reasons, Hong Kong Airlines has decided not to continue the journey and arranged replacing components to be transported to Sapporo today (4 October) for repair.
Repair and maintenance will start immediately upon arrival of the components, and is expected to take around 8 hours. However, due to curfew of New Chitose Airport, affected passengers are planned to return to Hong Kong tomorrow (5 October) at 8:55 a.m. local time, and arrive at 1:30 p.m. Hong Kong time. Accommodation, transportation allowance and subsidy will be presented to every passenger upon their arrival at the Hong Kong International Airport. For affected passengers who have decided to continue their journey with other airlines, please contact Hong Kong Airlines Call Center: (852) 3916 3666 (Hong Kong), or travel agent for refund arrangement of the Hong Kong Airlines ticket for Sapporo-Hong Kong sector.
Date Flight No. Route Changed flight no. Changed Departure time Changed Arrival time 3 October HX693 Sapporo to Hong Kong HX693D 5 October 08:55 5 October 13:30 *All local time
Hong Kong Airlines wishes to express our sincere apologies to any inconvenience caused to all affected passengers. We will continue to provide all feasible assistance to passengers concerned.
Source:- Hong Kong Airlines
